job description:
We are seeking an embedded firmware developer to design and implement code to test the interfaces of a custom circuit board that is built around a Texas Instruments Keystone 66AK2L06 multi-core System-on-Chip (SoC).
The ideal candidate would have the following qualifications:
  • 5 or more years industry experience working as an embedded firmware developer.
  • Experience with:

o Texas Instruments KeyStone II Multicore SoC Architecture
o Texas instruments TMS320C66x DSP core
o ARM® Cortex®-A15 MPCoreTM Processors
o JESD204B high speed data converter interface
o Setting up and using Linux on custom target hardware
o Texas Instruments SYS/BIOS RTOS
o Texas Instruments Code Composer integrated development environment
o Proficient in C programming
o Low level driver development
o "Bare metal programming
o Using electronic test equipment such as oscilloscopes.
